fullProgramDescription: The Department of German Studies at Stanford University offers a program leading to the Bachelor of Arts in German Studies. Students may pursue a major in German Studies by completing a program of study that includes coursework in German language, literature, and culture, as well as courses that focus on the historical and cultural contexts of the German-speaking world. The major is designed to provide students with a deep understanding of the German language and culture, as well as the skills to analyze and interpret complex texts and cultural artifacts.
shortProgramDescription: The German Studies major at Stanford provides students with a comprehensive understanding of German language, literature, and culture, preparing them for a range of careers or further study.
classHighlights: The German Studies major begins with foundational language courses (GERMAN 1-6 or equivalent), followed by a sequence of courses that introduce students to the literature, culture, and history of the German-speaking world (GERMAN 101-103).

Students then take a range of upper-division courses that focus on specific topics, such as German literature, culture, and history, including courses on the Enlightenment, Romanticism, and Modernism.
Advanced courses (GERMAN 171-199) allow students to explore specialized topics, such as German film, literature, and culture, and to develop their research and analytical skills.
Courses in the major emphasize the development of critical thinking, writing, and speaking skills, as well as the ability to analyze and interpret complex texts and cultural artifacts.
The major also encourages students to explore the intersections between German Studies and other disciplines, such as history, philosophy, and comparative literature.
learningOutcomes: Demonstrate a high level of proficiency in the German language.
Analyze and interpret complex texts and cultural artifacts from the German-speaking world.
Understand the historical and cultural contexts of the German-speaking world.
Develop critical thinking, writing, and speaking skills.
Explore the intersections between German Studies and other disciplines.
creditRequirements: 45 units of German coursework; total approx.180 quarter units
additionalInformation: Students are encouraged to study abroad in a German-speaking country. The major is designed to be flexible, allowing students to pursue their interests and career goals.
